participant_abstract.sent: We discussed the product - a new television remote control that is more trendy and user-friendly (market research tells us this is what people want).
The market is international, and the project manager presented the information about costs, price and profit.
We discussed problems with current remote controls, and whether the remote should just control the television, or whether it could control other devices.
We decided it should be robust.

We did not discuss how to market the remote control - I suggested a functionality concept for the remote which involved it controlling other devices but we decided to stick to the brief of a TV remote.
I need to think of ways to market the device for the next meeting.

participant_actions.sent: The project manager will summarise the last meeting and devise an agenda for the next one.
The industrial manager will find out about what materials the remote can be made from, and how we're going to manufacture it.
The user interface manager will find out how we're going to utilise these materials to make the experience of using the remote pleasurable.
The marketing manager will be finding out how we're going to market this device and what product features people want the most.

participant_decisions.sent: Decided to stick to a TV remote.
Decided that it had to be robust.
Decided that there are too many buttons on current remotes.

participant_problems.sent: The project manager had a few computer problems, but this did not undermine his role as the facilitator.
We had trouble sticking to talking about those things associated with our roles - i.e. I was describing a design idea, the project manager was chipping in with suggestions, etc..
